docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.
PHP version 5

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: 2011 Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: A RouterOS client.
docblock.long-description: Provides functionality for easily communicating with a RouterOS host.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: Used in {@link isRequestActive()} to limit search only to requests that have a callback.
Used in {@link isRequestActive()} to limit search only to requests that use the buffer.
Used in {@link isRequestActive()} to indicate no limit in search.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The communicator for this client.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The number of currently pending requests.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array of responses that have not yet been extracted or passed to a callback. Key is the tag of the request, and the value is an array of associated responses.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array of callbacks to be executed as responses come. Key is the tag of the request, and the value is the callback for it.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A registry for the operations. Particularly helpful at persistent connections.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Whether to stream future responses.

docblock.description: Creates a new instance of a RouterOS API client.
docblock.long-description: Creates a new instance of a RouterOS API client with the specified settings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Hostname (IP or domain) of the RouterOS server.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The RouterOS username.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The RouterOS password.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The port on which the RouterOS server provides the API service. You can also specify NULL, in which case the port will automatically be chosen between 8728 and 8729, depending on the value of $crypto.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not the connection should be a persistent one.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timeout for the connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The encryption for this connection. Must be one of the PEAR2\Net\Transmitter\NetworkStream::CRYPTO_* constants. Off by default. RouterOS currently supports only TLS, but the setting is provided in this fashion for forward compatibility's sake. And for the sake of simplicity, if you specify an encryption, don't specify a context and your default context uses the value "DEFAULT" for ciphers, "ADH" will be automatically added to the list of ciphers.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A context for the socket.

docblock.description: A shorthand gateway.
docblock.long-description: This is a magic PHP method that allows you to call the object as a function. Depending on the argument given, one of the other functions in the class is invoked and its returned value is returned by this function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value can be either a {@link Request} to send, which would be sent asynchoniously if it has a tag, and synchroniously if not, a number to loop with or NULL to complete all pending requests. Any other value is converted to string and treated as the tag of a request to complete.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Whatever the long form function would have returned.

docblock.description: Login to a RouterOS connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The communicator to attempt to login to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The RouterOS username.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The RouterOS password.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time to wait for each response. NULL waits indefinetly.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: Login to a RouterOS connection.
docblock.long-description: This is the actual login procedure, applied regardless of persistence and charset settings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The communicator to attempt to login to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The RouterOS username.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The RouterOS password. Potentially parsed already by iconv.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The time to wait for each response. NULL waits indefinetly.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection.
docblock.long-description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection. The specified charset(s) will be used for all future requests and responses. When sending, {@link Communicator::CHARSET_LOCAL} is converted to {@link Communicator::CHARSET_REMOTE}, and when receiving, {@link Communicator::CHARSET_REMOTE} is converted to {@link Communicator::CHARSET_LOCAL}. Setting NULL to either charset will disable charset convertion, and data will be both sent and received "as is".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The charset to set. If $charsetType is {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}, you can supply either a string to use for all charsets, or an array with the charset types as keys, and the charsets as values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to set. Valid values are the Communicator::CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The old charset. If $charsetType is {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}, the old values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the charset(s) for this connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to get. Valid values are the Communicator::CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current charset. If $charsetType is {@link Communicator::CHARSET_ALL}, the current values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Sends a request and waits for responses.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The request to send.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional. A function that is to be executed when new responses for this request are available. The callback takes two parameters. The {@link Response} object as the first, and the {@link Client} object as the second one. If the function returns TRUE, the request is canceled. Note that the callback may be executed one last time after that with a response that notifies about the canceling.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The client object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Checks if a request is active.
docblock.long-description: Checks if a request is active. A request is considered active if it's a pending request and/or has responses that are not yet extracted.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag of the request to look for.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of the FILTER_* consntants. Limits the search to the specified places.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the request is active, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Sends a request and gets the full response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The request to send.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The received responses as a collection.

docblock.description: Completes a specified request.
docblock.long-description: Starts an event loop for the RouterOS callbacks and finishes when a specified request is completed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag of the request to complete. Setting NULL completes all requests.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A collection of {@link Response} objects that haven't been passed to a callback function or previously extracted with {@link extractNewResponses()}. Returns an empty collection when $tag is set to NULL (responses can still be extracted).

docblock.description: Extracts responses for a request.
docblock.long-description: Gets all new responses for a request that haven't been passed to a callback and clears the buffer from them.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag of the request to extract new responses for. Specifying NULL with extract new responses for all requests.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A collection of {@link Response} objects for the specified request.

docblock.description: Starts an event loop for the RouterOS callbacks.
docblock.long-description: Starts an event loop for the RouterOS callbacks and finishes when there are no more pending requests or when a specified timeout has passed (whichever comes first).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Timeout for the loop. If NULL, there is no time limit.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Microseconds to add to the time limit.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE when there are any more pending requests, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Gets the number of pending requests.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of pending requests.

docblock.description: Cancels a request.
docblock.long-description: Cancels an active request. Using this function in favor of a plain call to the "/cancel" command is highly reccomended, as it also updates the counter of pending requests properly. Note that canceling a request also removes any responses for it that were not previously extracted with {@link extractNewResponses()}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Tag of the request to cancel. Setting NULL will cancel all requests.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The client object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Sets response streaming setting.
docblock.long-description: Sets whether future responses are streamed. If responses are streamed, the argument values are returned as streams instead of strings. This is particularly useful if you expect a response that may contain one or more very large words.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to stream future responses.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The previous value of the setting.

docblock.description: Gets response streaming setting.
docblock.long-description: Gets whether future responses are streamed.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the setting.

docblock.description: Closes the opened connection, even if it is a persistent one.
docblock.long-description: Closes the opened connection, even if it is a persistent one. Note that {@link extractNewResponses()} can still be used to extract responses collected prior to the closing.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: Closes the connection, unless it's a persistent one.
Sends a request to RouterOS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The request to send.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The client object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Dispatches the next response in queue.
docblock.long-description: Dispatches the next response in queue, i.e. it executes the associated callback if there is one, or places the response in the response buffer.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If a response is not immediatly available, wait this many seconds. If NULL, wait indefinetly.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Microseconds to add to the waiting time.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: When there's no response within the time limit.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The dispatched response.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.
PHP version 5

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: 2011 Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: A RouterOS communicator.
docblock.long-description: Implementation of the RouterOS API protocol. Unlike the other classes in this package, this class doesn't provide any conviniences beyond the low level implementation details (automatic word length encoding/decoding, charset translation and data integrity), and because of that, its direct usage is strongly discouraged.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: Used when getting/setting all (default) charsets.
Used when getting/setting the (default) remote charset.
docblock.long-description: The remote charset is the charset in which RouterOS stores its data. If you want to keep compatibility with your Winbox, this charset should match the default charset from your Windows' regional settings.

docblock.description: Used when getting/setting the (default) local charset.
docblock.long-description: The local charset is the charset in which the data from RouterOS will be returned as. This charset should match the charset of the place the data will eventually be written to.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with the default charset types as keys, and the default charsets as values.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with the current charset types as keys, and the current charsets as values.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The transmitter for the connection.

docblock.description: Creates a new connection with the specified options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Hostname (IP or domain) of the RouterOS server.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The port on which the RouterOS server provides the API service. You can also specify NULL, in which case the port will automatically be chosen between 8728 and 8729, depending on the value of $crypto.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not the connection should be a persistent one.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timeout for the connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string that uniquely identifies the connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The encryption for this connection. Must be one of the PEAR2\Net\Transmitter\NetworkStream::CRYPTO_* constants. Off by default. RouterOS currently supports only TLS, but the setting is provided in this fashion for forward compatibility's sake. And for the sake of simplicity, if you specify an encryption, don't specify a context and your default context uses the value "DEFAULT" for ciphers, "ADH" will be automatically added to the list of ciphers.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A context for the socket.

docblock.description: A shorthand gateway.
docblock.long-description: This is a magic PHP method that allows you to call the object as a function. Depending on the argument given, one of the other functions in the class is invoked and its returned value is returned by this function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string of the word to send, or NULL to get the next word as a string.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If a string is provided, returns the number of bytes sent, otherwise retuns the next word as a string.

docblock.description: Checks whether a variable is a seekable stream resource.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to check.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if $var is a seekable stream, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Uses iconv to convert a stream from one charset to another.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The charset of the stream.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The desired resulting charset.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The stream to convert.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A new stream that uses the $out_charset. The stream is a subset from the original stream, from its current position to its end.

docblock.description: Sets the default charset(s) for new connections.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The charset to set. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, you can supply either a string to use for all charsets, or an array with the charset types as keys, and the charsets as values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to set. Valid values are the CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The old charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the old values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the default charset(s).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to get. Valid values are the CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the current values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection.
docblock.long-description: Sets the charset(s) for this connection. The specified charset(s) will be used for all future words. When sending, {@link CHARSET_LOCAL} is converted to {@link CHARSET_REMOTE}, and when receiving, {@link CHARSET_REMOTE} is converted to {@link CHARSET_LOCAL}. Setting NULL to either charset will disable charset convertion, and data will be both sent and received "as is".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The charset to set. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, you can supply either a string to use for all charsets, or an array with the charset types as keys, and the charsets as values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to set. Valid values are the Communicator::CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The old charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the old values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the charset(s) for this connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Which charset to get. Valid values are the CHARSET_* constants. Any other value is treated as {@link CHARSET_ALL}.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current charset. If $charsetType is {@link CHARSET_ALL}, the current values will be returned as an array with the types as keys, and charsets as values.

docblock.description: Gets the transmitter for this connection.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The transmitter for this connection.

docblock.description: Sends a word.
docblock.long-description: Sends a word and automatically encodes its length when doing so.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The word to send.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of bytes sent.

docblock.description: Sends a word based on a stream.
docblock.long-description: Sends a word based on a stream and automatically encodes its length when doing so. The stream is read from its current position to its end, and then returned to its current position. Because of those operations, the supplied stream must be seekable.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string to prepend before the stream contents.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The stream to send.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of bytes sent.

docblock.description: Verifies that the length is supported.
docblock.long-description: Verifies if the specified length is supported by the API. Throws a {@link LengthException} if that's not the case. Currently, RouterOS supports words up to 0xFFFFFFF in length, so that's the only check performed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The length to verify.

docblock.description: Encodes the length as requred by the RouterOS API.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The length to encode.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The encoded length.

docblock.description: Get the next word in queue as a string.
docblock.long-description: Get the next word in queue as a string, after automatically decoding its length.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The word.

docblock.description: Get the next word in queue as a stream.
docblock.long-description: Get the next word in queue as a stream, after automatically decoding its length.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The word, as a stream.

docblock.description: Decodes the lenght of the incoming message.
docblock.long-description: Decodes the lenght of the incoming message, as specified by the RouterOS API.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The transmitter from which to decode the length of the incoming message.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The decoded length.

docblock.description: Decodes the lenght of the incoming message.
docblock.long-description:
Decodes the lenght of the incoming message, as specified by the RouterOS API.
Difference with the non private function is that this one doesn't perform locking if the connection is a persistent one.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The transmitter from which to decode the length of the incoming message.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The decoded length.

docblock.description: Closes the opened connection, even if it is a persistent one.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.
PHP version 5

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: 2011 Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: Exception thrown when the request/response cycle goes an unexpected way.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.

docblock.description: Exception thrown when there's something wrong with message arguments.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.
PHP version 5

docblock.description: Exception thrown when there is a problem with a word's length.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

tag.name: var
tag.description: The problematic length.

docblock.description: Creates a new LengthException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Exception message to throw.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Exception code.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The previous exception used for the exception chaining.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The length.

docblock.description: Gets the length.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The length.

docblock.description: Returns a string representation of the exception.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The exception as a string.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.
PHP version 5

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: 2011 Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: Represents a RouterOS message.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with message arguments. Keys are the names of the arguments, array values are values for the corresponding argument.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An optional tag to associate the message with.

docblock.description: A shorthand gateway.
docblock.long-description: This is a magic PHP method that allows you to call the object as a function. Depending on the argument given, one of the other functions in the class is invoked and its returned value is returned by this function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of an argument to get the value of, or NULL to get all arguments as an array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the specified argument, or an array of all arguments if NULL is provided.

docblock.description: Sanitizes a name of an argument (message or query one).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name to sanitize.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The sanitized name.

docblock.description: Sanitizes a value of an argument (message or query one).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to sanitize.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The sanitized value.

docblock.description: Gets the tag that the message is associated with.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current tag or NULL if there isn't a tag.

docblock.description: Sets the tag to associate the request with.
docblock.long-description: Sets the tag to associate the message with. Setting NULL erases the currently set tag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag to set.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The message object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Gets the value of an argument.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the argument.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the specified argument. Returns NULL if such an argument is not set.

docblock.description: Gets all arguments in an array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with the keys as argument names, and the array values as argument values.

docblock.description: Sets an argument for the message.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the argument.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value of the argument. Setting the value to NULL removes an argument of this name.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The message object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Removes all arguments from the message.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The message object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

tag.name: var
tag.description: The unsuppported value.

docblock.description: Creates a new NotSupportedException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Exception message to throw.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Exception code.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The previous exception used for the exception chaining.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The unsupported value.

docblock.description: Gets the unsupported value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The unsupported value.

docblock.description: Returns a string representation of the exception.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The exception as a string.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.
PHP version 5

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: 2011 Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license

docblock.description: Represents a query for RouterOS requests.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: Checks if the property exists.
Checks if the property does not exist.
Checks if the property equals a certain value.
Checks if the property is less than a certain value.
Checks if the property is greather than a certain value.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array of the words forming the query. Each value is an array with the first member being the predicate (action and name), and the second member being the value for the predicate.

docblock.description: This class is not to be instantiated normally, but by static methods instead. Use {@link where()} to create an instance of it.

docblock.description: A RouterOS registry.
docblock.long-description:
Provides functionality for managing the request/response flow. Particularly useful in persistent connections.
Note that this class is not meant to be called directly.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

tag.name: var
tag.description: The storage.

tag.name: var
tag.description: ID of request. Populated at first instance in request.

tag.name: var
tag.description: ID to be given to next instance, after incrementing it.

tag.name: var
tag.description: ID of instance within the request.

docblock.description: Creates a registry.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An URI to bind the registry to.

docblock.description: Parses a tag.
docblock.long-description: Parses a tag to reveal the ownership part of it, and the original tag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag (as received) to parse.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with the first member being the ownership tag, and the second one being the original tag.

docblock.description: Checks if this instance is the tagless mode owner.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if this instance is the tagless mode owner, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Sets the "tagless mode" setting.
docblock.long-description:
While in tagless mode, this instance will claim owhership of any responses without a tag. While not in this mode, any requests without a tag will be given to all instances.
Regardless of mode, if the type of the response is {@link Response::TYPE_FATAL}, it will be given to all instances.

tag.name: param
tag.description: TRUE to claim tagless ownership, FALSE to release such ownership, if taken.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: Get the ownership tag for this instance.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The ownership tag for this registry instance.

docblock.description: Add a response to the registry.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The response to add. The caller of this function is responsible for ensuring that the ownership tag and the original tag are separated, so that only the original one remains in the response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ownership tag that the response had.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the request was added to its buffer, FALSE if this instance owns the response, and therefore doesn't need to add the response to its buffer.

docblock.description: Adds a response to a buffer.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The response to add.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the buffer to add the response to.

docblock.description: Gets the next response from this instance's buffer.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The next response, or NULL if there isn't one.

docblock.description: Closes the registry.
docblock.long-description: Closes the registry, meaning that all buffers are cleared.

docblock.description: Removes a buffer.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The buffer to remove.

docblock.description: Removes this instance's buffer.

RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.

docblock.description: Represents a RouterOS request.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

tag.name: var
tag.description: The command to be executed.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A query for the command.

docblock.description: Creates a request to send to RouterOS.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The command to send. Can also contain arguments expressed in a shell-like syntax.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A query to associate with the request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag for the request.

docblock.description: A shorthand gateway.
docblock.long-description: This is a magic PHP method that allows you to call the object as a function. Depending on the argument given, one of the other functions in the class is invoked and its returned value is returned by this function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A {@link Query} to associate the request with, a {@link Communicator} to send the request over, an argument to get the value of, or NULL to get all arguments as an array. If a second argument is provided, this becomes the name of the argument to set the value of, and the second argument is the value to set.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Whatever the long form function would have returned.

docblock.description: Sets the command to send to RouterOS.
docblock.long-description: Sets the command to send to RouterOS. The command can use the API or CLI syntax of RouterOS, but either way, it must be absolute (begin with a "/") and without arguments.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The command to send.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The request object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Gets the command that will be send to RouterOS.
docblock.long-description: Gets the command that will be send to RouterOS in its API syntax.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The command to send.

docblock.description: Sets the query to send with the command.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query to be set. Setting NULL will remove the currently associated query.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The request object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Gets the currently associated query

tag.name: return
tag.description: The currently associated query.

docblock.description: Sets the tag to associate the request with.
docblock.long-description: Sets the tag to associate the request with. Setting NULL erases the currently set tag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag to set.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The request object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Sets an argument for the request.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the argument.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value of the argument. Setting the value to NULL removes an argument of this name.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The request object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Removes all arguments from the request.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The request object.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: The last response for a request.
A response with data.
A response signifying error.

tag.description: If a response is not immediatly available, wait this many seconds. If NULL, wait indefinetly.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Microseconds to add to the waiting time.

docblock.description: Extracts a new response from a communicator.

docblock.description: Represents a collection of RouterOS responses.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with all {@link Response} objects.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with each {@link Response} object's type.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with each {@link Response} object's tag.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with all distinct arguments across all {@link Response} objects. Created at the first call of {@link getArgumentMap()}.

tag.name: var
tag.description: A pointer, as required by SeekableIterator.

docblock.description: Creates a new collection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of responses, in network order.

docblock.description: A shorthand gateway.
docblock.long-description: This is a magic PHP method that allows you to call the object as a function. Depending on the argument given, one of the other functions in the class is invoked and its returned value is returned by this function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The offset of the response to seek to. Setting NULL will seek to the last response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The {@link Response} at the specified index, last reponse if no index is provided or FALSE if the index is invalid or the collection is empty.

docblock.description: Gets the whole collection as an array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with all responses, in network order.

docblock.description: Counts the responses in the collection.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of responses in the collection.

docblock.description: Checks if an offset exists.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The offset to check.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the offset exists, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Gets a {@link Response} from a specified offset.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The offset of the desired response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The response at the specified offset.

docblock.description: N/A
docblock.long-description: This method exists only because it is required for ArrayAccess. The collection is read only.

docblock.description: N/A
docblock.long-description: This method exists only because it is required for ArrayAccess. The collection is read only.

docblock.description: Resets the pointer to 0, and returns the first response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The first response in the collection, or FALSE if the collection is empty.

docblock.description: Moves the position pointer to a specified position.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The position to move to.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The {@link Response} at the specified position, or FALSE if the specified position is not valid.

docblock.description: Moves the pointer forward by 1, and gets the next response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The next {@link Response} object, or FALSE if the position is not valid.

docblock.description: Gets the response at the current pointer position.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The response at the current pointer position, or FALSE if the position is not valid.

docblock.description: Moves the pointer backwards by 1, and gets the previous response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The next {@link Response} object, or FALSE if the position is not valid.

docblock.description: Moves the pointer to the last valid position, and returns the last response.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The last response in the collection, or FALSE if the collection is empty.

docblock.description: Gets the key at the current pointer position.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The key at the current pointer position, i.e. the pointer position itself, or FALSE if the position is not valid.

docblock.description: Checks if the pointer is still pointing to an existing offset.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the pointer is valid, FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Gets all distinct argument names.
docblock.long-description: Gets all distinct argument names across all responses.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with all distinct argument names as keys, and the indexes at which they occur as values.

docblock.description: Gets all responses of a specified type.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The response type to filter by. Valid values are the Response::TYPE_* constants.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A new collection with responses of the specified type.

docblock.description: Gets all responses with a specified tag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag to filter by.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A new collection with responses having the specified tag.

docblock.description: Gets the last {@link Response} in the collection.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The last response in the collection or FALSE if the collection is empty.

docblock.description: Calls a method of the response pointed by the pointer.
docblock.long-description: Calls a method of the response pointed by the pointer. This is a magic PHP method, thanks to which any function you call on the collection that is not defined will be redirected to the response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method to call.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments to pass to the method.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Whatever the called function returns.

docblock.description: RouterOS API client implementation.
docblock.long-description:
RouterOS is the flag product of the company MikroTik and is a powerful router software. One of its many abilities is to allow control over it via an API. This package provides a client for that API, in turn allowing you to use PHP to control RouterOS hosts.
PHP version 5

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: 2011 Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

docblock.description: Utility class.
docblock.long-description: Abstracts away frequently used functionality (particularly CRUD operations) in convinient to use methods by wrapping around a connection.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Vasil Rangelov

tag.name: license
tag.description: LGPL License 2.1

tag.name: var
tag.description: The connection to wrap around.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The current menu.

tag.name: var
tag.description: An array with the numbers of entries in the current menu as keys, and the corresponding IDs as values.

docblock.description: Parses a value from a RouterOS scripting context.
docblock.long-description:
Turns a value from RouterOS into an equivalent PHP value, based on determining the type in the same way RouterOS would determine it for a literal.
This method is intended to be the very opposite of {@link escapeValue()}. That is, results from that method, if given to this method, should produce equivalent results.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to be parsed. Must be a literal of a value, e.g. what {@link escapeValue()} will give you.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Depending on RouterOS type detected: - "nil" or "nothing" - NULL. - "number" - int or double for large values. - "bool" - a boolean. - "time" - a {@link DateInterval} object. - "array" - an array, with the values processed recursively. - "str" - a string. - Unrecognized type - treated as an unquoted string.

docblock.description: Escapes a value for a RouterOS scripting context.
docblock.long-description:
Turns any native PHP value into an equivalent whole value that can be inserted as part of a RouterOS script.
DateTime and DateInterval objects will be casted to RouterOS' "time" type. A DateTime object will be converted to a time relative to the UNIX epoch time. Note that if a DateInterval does not have the "days" property ("a" in formatting), then its months and years will be ignored, because they can't be unambigiously converted to a "time" value.
Unrecognized types are casted to strings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to be escaped.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A string representation that can be directly inserted in a script as a whole value.

docblock.description: Escapes a string for a RouterOS scripting context.
docblock.long-description: Escapes a string for a RouterOS scripting context. The value can be surrounded with quotes at a RouterOS script (or concatenated onto a larger string first), and you can be sure there won't be any code injections coming from it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to be escaped.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The escaped value.

docblock.description: Escapes a character for a RouterOS scripting context.
docblock.long-description: Escapes a character for a RouterOS scripting context. Intended to only be called for non-alphanumeric characters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The matches array, expected to contain exactly one member, in which is the whole string to be escaped.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The escaped character.

docblock.description: Creates a new Util instance.
docblock.long-description: Wraps around a connection to provide convinience methods.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The connection to wrap around.

docblock.description: Changes the current menu.
docblock.long-description: Changes the current menu.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The menu to change to. Can be specified with API or CLI syntax and can be either absolute or relative. If relative, it's relative to the current menu, which by default is the root.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The old menu. If an empty string is given for a new menu, no change is performed, and this function returns the current menu.

docblock.description: Executes a RouterOS script.
docblock.long-description: Executes a RouterOS script, written as a string. Note that in cases of errors, the line numbers will be off, because the script is executed at the current menu as context, with the specified variables pre declared. This is achieved by prepending 1+count($params) lines before your actual script.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A script to execute.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of local variables to make available in the script. Variable names are array keys, and variable values are array values. Array values are automatically processed with {@link escapeValue()}. Note that the script's (generated) name is always added as the variable "_", which you can overwrite from here.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Allows you to specify a policy the script must follow. Has the same format as in terminal. If left NULL, the script has no restrictions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The script is executed after being saved in "/system script" under a random name (prefixed with the computer's name), and is removed after execution. To eliminate any possibility of name clashes, you can specify your own name.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection of the run, allowing you to inspect errors, if any. If the script was not added successfully before execution, the ResponseCollection from the add attempt is going to be returned.

docblock.description: Clears the ID cache.
docblock.long-description:
Normally, the ID cache improves performance when targeting entries by a number. If you're using both Util's methods and other means (e.g. {@link Client} or {@link Util::exec()}) to add/move/remove entries, the cache may end up being out of date. By calling this method right before targeting an entry with a number, you can ensure number accuracy.
Note that Util's {@link move()} and {@link remove()} methods automatically clear the cache before returning, while {@link add()} adds the new entry's ID to the cache as the next number. A change in the menu also clears the cache.
Note also that the cache is being rebuilt unconditionally every time you use {@link find()} with a callback.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Util object itself.

tag.name: fluent
tag.description: This method is part of a fluent interface and will return the same instance

docblock.description: Finds the IDs of entries at the current menu.
docblock.long-description:
Finds the IDs of entries based on specified criteria, and returns them as a comma separated string, ready for insertion at a "numbers" argument.
Accepts zero or more criteria as arguments. If zero arguments are specified, returns all entries' IDs. The value of each criteria can be a number (just as in Winbox), a literal ID to be included, a {@link Query} object, or a callback. If a callback is specified, it is called for each entry, with the entry as an argument. If it returns a true value, the item's ID is included in the result. Every other value is casted to a string. A string is treated as a comma separated values of IDs, numbers or callback names. Non-existent callback names are instead placed in the result, which may be useful in menus that accept identifiers other than IDs, but note that it can cause errors on other menus.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A comma separated list of all entries matching the specified criteria.

docblock.description: Gets a value of a specified entry at the current menu.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A number identifying the entry you're targeting. Can also be an ID or (in some menus) name. For menus where there are no entries (e.g. "/system identity"), you can specify NULL.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the value you want to get.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the specified property. If the property is not set, NULL will be returned. If no such entry exists, FALSE will be returned.

docblock.description: Enables all entries at the current menu matching certain criteria.
docblock.long-description: Zero or more arguments can be specified, each being a criteria. If zero arguments are specified, enables all entries. See {@link find()} for a description of what criteria are accepted.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection, allowing you to inspect errors, if any.

docblock.description: Disables all entries at the current menu matching certain criteria.
docblock.long-description: Zero or more arguments can be specified, each being a criteria. If zero arguments are specified, disables all entries. See {@link find()} for a description of what criteria are accepted.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection, allowing you to inspect errors, if any.

docblock.description: Removes all entries at the current menu matching certain criteria.
docblock.long-description: Zero or more arguments can be specified, each being a criteria. If zero arguments are specified, removes all entries. See {@link find()} for a description of what criteria are accepted.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection, allowing you to inspect errors, if any.

docblock.description: Sets new values.
docblock.long-description: Sets new values on certain properties on all entries at the current menu which match certain criteria.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Targeted entries. Can be any criteria accepted by {@link find()} or NULL in case the menu is one without entries (e.g. "/system identity").

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array with the names of each property to set as an array key, and the new value as an array value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection, allowing you to inspect errors, if any.

docblock.description: Alias of {@link set()}

tag.name: param
tag.description: Targeted entries. Can be any criteria accepted by {@link find()}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array with the names of each changed property as an array key, and the new value as an array value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection, allowing you to inspect errors, if any.

docblock.description: Unsets a value of a specified entry at the current menu.
docblock.long-description: Equivalent of scripting's "unset" command. The "Value" part in the method name is added because "unset" is a language construct, and thus a reserved word.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Targeted entries. Can be any criteria accepted by {@link find()}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the value you want to unset.

docblock.description: Adds a new entry at the current menu.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Accepts one or more entries to add to the current menu. The data about each entry is specified as an array with the names of each property as an array key, and the value as an array value.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Additional entries.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A comma separated list of the new entries' IDs.

docblock.description: Moves entries at the current menu before a certain other entry.
docblock.long-description: Moves entries before a certain other entry. Note that the "move" command is not available on all menus. As a rule of thumb, if the order of entries in a menu is irrelevant to their interpretation, there won't be a move command on that menu. If in doubt, check from a terminal.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Targeted entries. Can be any criteria accepted by {@link find()}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Entry before which the targeted entries will be moved to. Can be any criteria accepted by {@link find()}. If multiple entries match the criteria, the targeted entries will move above the first match.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection, allowing you to inspect errors, if any.

docblock.description: Puts a file on RouterOS's file system.
docblock.long-description: Puts a file on RouterOS's file system, regardless of the current menu. Note that this is a **VERY VERY VERY** time consuming method - it takes a minimum of a little over 4 seconds, most of which are in sleep. It waits 2 seconds after a file is first created (required to actually start writing to the file), and another 2 seconds after its contents is written (performed in order to verify success afterwards). If you want an efficient way of transferring files, use (T)FTP.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The filename to write data in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data the file is going to have.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to overwrite the file if it exists.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

docblock.description: Gets the contents of a specified file.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the file to get the contents of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: In order to get the file's contents, a script is created at "/system script" with a random name, the source of which is then overwriten with the file's contents, and finally retrieved. To eliminate any possibility of name clashes, you can specify your own name for the script.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The contents of the file or FALSE if there is no such file.

docblock.description: Performs an action on a bulk of entries at the current menu.

tag.name: param
tag.description: What action to perform.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Zero or more arguments can be specified, each being a criteria. If zero arguments are specified, removes all entries. See {@link find()} for a description of what criteria are accepted.

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the response collection, allowing you to inspect errors, if any.

docblock.description: Executes a RouterOS script.
docblock.long-description: Same as the public equivalent, with the addition of allowing you to get the contents of the script post execution, instead of removing it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A script to execute.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of local variables to make available in the script. Variable names are array keys, and variable values are array values. Note that the script's (generated) name is always added as the variable "_", which you can overwrite from here. Native PHP types will be converted to their RouterOS equivalents. DateTime and DateInterval objects will be casted to RouterOS' "time" type. Other types are casted to strings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Allows you to specify a policy the script must follow. Has the same format as in terminal. If left NULL, the script has no restrictions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The script is executed after being saved in "/system script" under a random name (prefixed with the computer's name), and is removed after execution. To eliminate any possibility of name clashes, you can specify your own name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to keep the script after execution.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the script was not added successfully before execution, the ResponseCollection from the add attempt is going to be returned. Otherwise, the (generated) name of the script.
